usefulItems: large bowl, thermal serving bowl or other large bowl, plastic wrap, refrigerator
title: Pork and gravy with red wine cabbage

ingredients.content: 1 ½ tsp salt, plus extra to taste
40 g pitted prunes, plus 3 extra prunes
500 g red cabbage, cut into pieces
200 g brown onion, cut into quarters
6 dried shiitake mushrooms or dried porcini mushrooms (see Tips)
2 - 3 potatoes (approx. 300-350 g), peeled and cut into 3-4 cm pieces

preparations.content: Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh pork into it. Remove bowl and sprinkle both sides of the fillets with pepper, paprika and ½ teaspoon of the salt, then drizzle with oil. Cover and place into refrigerator to marinate while proceeding with recipe.
Place 40 g of the prunes into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>.
Add cabbage and chop <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>, mixing with aid of spatula.
Add raisins, wine, butter, sugar, cloves and remaining 1 teaspoon salt and cook <b>25 min/100°C//speed 1<b>.
Add vinegar and cook <b>5 min/100°C//speed 1<b>. Season to taste. Transfer into a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl and cover to keep warm. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place onion and garlic into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>.

Add tomato paste, mushrooms, remaining 3 prunes, stock paste and water. Place Varoma into position and divide marinated meat and potatoes between Varoma dish and Varoma tray. Secure Varoma lid and cook <b>35-40 min/Varoma/speed 1<b> or until pork and potatoes are cooked to your liking. Remove Varoma and set aside to keep warm.
Blend sauce <b>30 sec/speed 4<b>-<b>9, increasing speed gradually from speed 4 to speed 9<b>. Serve pork with gravy, potatoes and cabbage.

hintsAndTricks: Please refer to The Basic Cookbook or the Everyday Cookbook for the Vegetable stock paste recipe.

Dried shiitake mushrooms can be found in the international food aisle of most major supermarkets. Dried porcini mushrooms can be found at gourmet or specialty food stores; they are often more expensive than the dried shiitake variety, but they add an extra depth of flavour.
